oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Johne's Disease in the Maritime Districts of Canada: Prevalence Estimate Adjusted for Test Variability

precision

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ignoring the limited precision of diagnostic tests can incur serious bias in prevalence (P) estimation. Most studies treat the sensitivity (SE) and specificity (SP) of the tests as constants. This will result in an underestimation of the variability of P. Bayesian inference provides a natural framework with which to integrate the variability in the estimates of SE and SP with estimation of P.1
